laboratory_examinations.findings: Metaplastic glandular mucosa with goblet cells consistent with Barrett’s esophagus with high-grade dysplasia.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Persistent signs of Barrett’s esophagus with high-grade dysplasia at follow-up four months later.

laboratory_examinations.findings: 5-cm-long segment with signs consistent with Barrett’s esophagus and polypoid lesion, 1 cm in diameter.
Intramucosal carcinoma confirmed; high-grade dysplasia extended to the lateral margin.
Moderately severe esophagitis within the treated segment observed two days post-treatment.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Symptoms included nausea, odynophagia, and chest discomfort post-therapy; improvement after dilation of benign stenosis noted four weeks later.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Specialized columnar epithelium without dysplasia; absence of neoplastic epithelium.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: No recurrence of Barrett’s esophagus or dysplasia noted at follow-up 46 months after the procedure.
